intro: Hoffmannseggella × itabiritensis, commonly known as the Itabira hybrid, is a rare and naturally occurring hybrid plant species. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology. The plant typically exhibits traits from both parental species, showcasing a blend of morphological features. It is native to Brazil and is found in specific habitats within the state of Minas Gerais. Due to its limited distribution and unique genetic makeup, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
